sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 1, 1912
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Gärtner’s Besuch im Café. Brief der N. Fr. Pr. als Antwort an Godowsky; meine Anregung allerdings radikaler Natur, s. Brief.
Begleichung großer Geldposten.
Gärtner's visit in the cafe. The letter for the Neue freie Presse, as a reply to Godowsky; my suggestion, at any rate, of a radical nature; see the letter.
Settlement of a large amount of money sent in the mail.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 4, 1912
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Abend: Fitelberg – Godowsky. According to the theater and art news in the Neue freie Presse (p. 17), this "symphony concert" took place in the Great Hall of the Musikverein. Grzegorz Fitelberg conducted the orchestra of the Vienna Concert Society. Ersterer steckt den 1. Satz der 2. Brahmssymphonie in eine falsch s. v. -Stimmung u. verstößt auch das ganze Werk hindurch gegen die dynamischen Postulate u. solche des Zeitmaßes. Godowsky, Gdur Konzert v. Beeth.: glatt u. flink in den Scalen, ohne Beziehung aber zum wesentlichen Inhalt; auf tiefstem Niveau die Kadenzen, deren Zusammenlegspiel jeglicher kompositorischen Fantasie entbehrte.

Evening: Fitelberg – Godowsky. The former puts the first movement of Brahms's Second Symphony in an incorrect sotto voce mood, and the entire work also offends against the dynamic postulates throughout, and those of tempo. Godowsky, Beethoven's G major Concerto: smooth and nimble in the scales, but without any understanding of the true content; the cadenzas of the lowest standard, the pasting together of which dispensed with all compositional imagination.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: „Verschenkte Frau“ von d’Albert: Eugen d'Albert's comic opera was premiered in Vienna on February 6, 1912, at the Court Opera Theater (now the Vienna State Opera). unerlaubt banal; lehrreich: in Mitten der FloskelFloskeln?, die auch mit entsprechender musikalischer „Länge“ unterstrichene letzte Scene des II. Aktes.
Die verschenkte Frau by d'Albert: unacceptably banal; instructive: in the midst of clichés, the final scene of Act 2, which is also underscored with corresponding musical "length."

tei:ab.tei:seg: Bogen 9, S 131–56, Beethovens Neunte Sinfonie abgeschlossen. „Antaios“, v. Trebitsch. Wirkungslosigkeit , weil von nur scheinbar tiefen die Gedanken; flaches Denken, – flaches Schreiben.
Proof sheet no. 9, pp. 131–56 of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony completed. Antaios by Trebitsch: ineffective, because the ideas only appear profound; shallow thinking, – shallow writing.

tei:ab.tei:seg: Vormittag bei Miethke: Manet, Monet, Courbet, Cezanne.
(Vrieslander 4-stimmiger Satz.)
Abends bei Harpner.
In the morning, at the Miethke Gallery: Manet, Monet, Courbet, Cezanne.
(Vrieslander: four-part counterpoint.)
In the evening, at Harpner's.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 16, 1912
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Grünfeld, : Adur Konzert v. Mozart, läppisch gespielt. According to the theater and arts page in the Neue freie Presse (p. 12), this concert took place in the Great Hall of the Musikverein. Julius Lehnert conducted the orchestra of the Society of the Friends of Music.
Grünfeld: Mozart's Concerto in A major, ludicrously performed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Elias: ( Clar. Sonate ). From the contemporary lessonbook, one can identify this work as Brahms's Sonata in F minor, Op. 120, No. 1. Affaire des ihres Bruders.
Elias: (Clarinet Sonata). Her brother's affair.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 18, 1912
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Probe des Trio von Floriz; erste wirklich gute Arbeit, u. doch wieder nicht ganz frei von Lässigkeit, ja Cynismus. Aeußere Befolgung gediegenster Technik.
Rehearsal of the Trio by Floriz; his first truly good piece of work, and yet it is still not entirely free of laxity, even cynicism. Superficial observance of the strictest technique.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker February 22, 1912
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Violin’s Konzert: schöner Erfolg des Trio u. der Klavierstücke Weisse’s; Hans Weisse, Klavierstücke (1911: see OJ 5/16, [1]). die Lieder des letzteren Hans Weisse, Rückert Lieder (1912 or earlier: see OJ 5/15, [1]). litten unter den Mangel an Proben, wie denn Florizen eine mangelhafte Vorbereitung zu Konzerten, sofern es auf die Mitwirkung Dritter ankommt, leider stets zur Last gelegt werden muß. Nach dem Konzert in Floriz’ Gesellschaft.

Violin's concert: a nice success of the trio, and of Weisse's piano pieces; the latter's songs suffered from a lack of rehearsals, since Floriz's deficient preparation for concerts in which a third party is involved must, unfortunately, always be blamed for this. After the concert, in Floriz's company.
